image.altText: Beryl sits outside in the sunlight in front of a tree, looking at the camera with an inscrutable expression.

props.synopsis: As the Northern Territory prison population continues to reach all-time highs, data reveals a majority of the NT's rehab program are being cancelled more often than they are being delivered.

title.children: NT prisons so crammed 'girls are sleeping at reception', ex-prisoner says

image.altText: A close up on a hand holding a mobile phone with two betting company brands visible on the screen.

props.synopsis: More than 40 of Australia's corporate bookmakers are based in the Northern Territory for its low taxes and what critics describe as weak regulation.

title.children: Calls for inquiry into Australia's de facto online gambling regulator

image.altText: A woman wearing a dress, holding her partner's hand as she walks towards the courthouse.

props.synopsis: A defamation trial over a press release issued by Northern Territory senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price has been derailed by an "unusual and significant" application to have a man barred from the court.

title.children: Senator’s defamation trial derailed over bid to have man excluded from court

image.altText: 3x3 Widest

props.synopsis: After former principal Gavin Morris was found guilty on four counts of aggravated assault, pressure is growing to explain a confidential 2024 assessment of Yipirinya School.

title.children: Calls mount to explain Yipirinya School review after ex-principal found guilty

image.altText: A women with short dark hair and glasses looks seriously at the camera.

props.synopsis: IUDs can be inserted by GPs, gynaecologists and family planning doctors, but in Alice Springs there aren't enough local professionals trained to do so.

title.children: Women waiting months, considering interstate travel for birth control

image.altText: Darwin Harbour InpexLNGLiquified Natural Gas

props.synopsis: The NT government has opened an investigation into oil and gas giant Inpex after the company admitted it has been under-reporting potentially toxic emissions from its flagship Ichthys LNG plant on Darwin Harbour.

title.children: Gas giant Inpex under investigation after admitting to emissions error

image.altText: A man in a checked shirt holding a new born baby

props.synopsis: Timothy Hunt is sentenced to life in prison for the murder of missing Darwin man Tony Rowe, in what Justice Sonia Brownhill described as a "bizarre, brutal and cowardly attack".

title.children: Timothy Hunt sentenced to life in prison for missing Darwin man's murder

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair speaking while looking off camera.

props.synopsis: Senator Lidia Thorpe refers Northern Territory's attorney-general to the corruption watchdog after allegations of government interference in the NT Supreme Court's media activities that were later deemed "a misunderstanding".

title.children: Lidia Thorpe refers NT attorney-general to corruption watchdog

image.altText: Four men stand in front of outback pub

props.synopsis: Northern Territory government backbenchers charge taxpayers thousands of dollars in travel as "assistant ministers", a role not officially recognised by the parliament.

title.children: 'Gammon' assistant minister roles rack up travel costs on public purse

image.altText: A checkout stacked with groceries including tomato sauce and shampoo

props.synopsis: Independent wholesale distributors are calling on the federal government to reconsider the $50 million food subsidy scheme for remote stores that rolled out on July 1 of this year.

title.children: Remote food subsidy scheme accused of creating a monopoly

image.altText: A man dressed in a wetsuit stands on a boat.

props.synopsis: It is estimated half of the local seagrass habitat in Gamay (Botany Bay) has already been lost. Researchers and Aboriginal rangers are replanting seagrass fragments and using biochar to restore the area.

title.children: 'Localised extinction': Saving the seagrass near one of the busiest ports in the country

image.altText: Two teenage girls alongside polaroid-style pictures of gymnastic performances

props.synopsis: Gymnasts as young as 13 say they were bullied, fat-shamed and humiliated at a Queensland gymnastics club, then forced out when their families complained.

title.children: Gymnasts allege body shaming, humiliation, before being forced out

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera smiling with her 10-month-old baby whose face is pixalated in this photo.

props.synopsis: As the European Union proposes a ban on the entire PFAS chemical class, some researchers say Australia should do the same.

title.children: Calls for Australia to follow Europe's push to ban 'forever chemicals'

image.altText: Prince Andrew in ceremonial clothes looks out a rainy window

props.synopsis: Sir Keir Starmer has told British parliament he supports scrutiny of Crown property deals but getting Prince Andrew to answer questions at Westminster might not be easy.

title.children: UK PM backs calls for Prince Andrew to face MPs over Royal Lodge deal

image.altText: A dark-haired, bearded man in a sports tracksuit holds an Israeli flag while raising his arms in triumph.

props.synopsis: The world's most populous Muslim nation refused to issue visas to Israeli athletes last week because of the war in Gaza.

title.children: Indonesia's ban on Israeli athletes sparks backlash from IOC

image.altText: A composite image of Mark Haines with railway tracks.

props.synopsis: Some key questions about the death of Indigenous teenager Mark Haines are still unanswered after a coronial inquest spanning five weeks.

title.children: After five weeks of evidence, this is what we know about the Mark Haines mystery

image.altText: Bridget McKenzie - 2025-05-20 12:56:41

props.synopsis: Bridget McKenzie says she thinks Barnaby Joyce will remain in the Nationals party room after he left the door open to joining One Nation. Follow live.

title.children: Coalition frontbencher says rumours about Joyce joining One Nation 'hoopla'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: King hasn't set deadline on response to learner driver safety
Rumours about Joyce moving to One Nation 'a lot of hoopla about nothing': Bridget McKenzie
Greens criticise decision to exclude 'climate trigger' from environment laws

image.altText: Silver and gold bars

props.synopsis: Precious metal prices have been pushing record highs and, as queues lengthened outside bullion traders, gold and silver prices suddenly fell back. But positive signs remain, analysts say.

title.children: A silver lining for investors rushing into precious metals

image.altText: A helicopter hovers in a grey sky as a person hangs from a line above white capped water.

props.synopsis: Two men have died after reportedly being swept from a pier at Frankston as part of the state recorded wind gusts up to 130 kilometres per hour during a severe weather system.

title.children: Two dead after being pulled from water during Victoria's wild weather

image.altText: A photo of two Samsung Galaxy7 smartphones

props.synopsis: Some Samsung mobile phone users may be unable to call triple-0 in an emergency after Telstra announced testing had revealed more than 70 models were not connecting correctly.

title.children: Some Samsung phones unable to make triple-0 calls

image.altText: A woman sits huddled under a statue of two hands which make a love-heart shape around her

props.synopsis: An ongoing censorship crackdown in Russia sees a teenage band jailed after a performance of an anti-Kremlin song went viral, but the protest keeps growing.

title.children: Meet the Russians rebelling against Putin with music

image.altText: Supporters of the legal action outside court in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: The mother of a trans teenager launched legal action over the state's freeze on puberty blockers earlier this year.

title.children: Queensland court reserves decision on puberty blocker ban

image.altText: Orange virus particles on a white and green dotted background

props.synopsis: Mpox transmission surged between July to September last year, but there have been far fewer cases recorded in 2025.

title.children: Mpox cases hit a record high in 2024. It's a different story this year

image.altText: A close up of Matildas coach Joe Montemurro's face with the Australian flag on a big screen in the background

props.synopsis: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro has no shortage of ideas or passion for how to reshape women's football in Australia, and it's a contrast from his predecessor.

title.children: ‘We need to do more’: Matildas coach outlines vision for women's game

image.altText: Searing sun and heat haze on horizon at Westbrook.

props.synopsis: The mercury in parts of the state's south-east is today forecast to reach the mid to high-30s as a heatwave sweeps through.

title.children: South-east Queensland bracing for ‘exceptional’ temperatures

image.altText: Various images of two men partipacting in a local parkrun in Karratha, WA.

props.synopsis: Shaded and green spaces can be hard to find in northern towns and cities where summer temperatures regularly surpass 40 degrees Celsius.

title.children: Climate adaptation 'shortfall' exposes vulnerability to hotter temperatures

image.altText: F1 driver walking to his car, holding an umbrella above his head, with a TV camera focused on him from behind

props.synopsis: This year may be the first time in F1 that Oscar Piastri has been under the cosh of a title fight, but it is not the first time he has been in a three-way fight for a championship.

title.children: Piastri may need to show 'evidence' of form under pressure in Mexico

image.altText: A man is arrested by police and handcuffed

props.synopsis: Three men charged over a machete brawl outside Melbourne's Luna Park have been freed on bail, despite police urging magistrates to keep the trio locked up.

title.children: 'Grow up fast': Magistrates release men after Luna Park machete brawl

image.altText: P8 Poseidon

props.synopsis: Beijing ramps up criticisms of Australia over a tense military encounter over the South China Sea on Sunday, accusing the Australian Defence Force of distributing "twisted and absurd propaganda" and "provoking" China.

title.children: China increases criticism after tense military encounter between planes

image.altText: Hannah Thomas with glasses outside court.

props.synopsis: The police officer charged with allegedly assaulting former Greens candidate Hannah Thomas is now facing an additional, more serious, offence.

title.children: Police officer charged with extra offence over Hannah Thomas arrest

image.altText: Two men in suits speak.

props.synopsis: The official will participate in planning and coordination efforts related to humanitarian and security challenges in implementing the ceasefire.

title.children: Australian official to join Trump's Gaza peace taskforce

image.altText: A close-up of fresh fish for sale at a market.

props.synopsis: There are microplastics in almost everything, so why does seafood get such a bad reputation? Scientists say it is down to disproportionate research and media attention.

title.children: Microplastics 'misconception' hurting seafood sector, scientists say

image.altText: Two small dogs sitting on a bed in a pet resort room stare warily at the camera.

props.synopsis: The Australian Bureau of Statistics has already confirmed it will not include the topic in the next census in 2026.

title.children: Brisbane City Council launches bid to have pets counted in census

image.altText: A glass cabinet with a silver tiara with green gems on it

props.synopsis: INTERPOL has circulated a "special edition poster" alerting police worldwide to "priceless" stolen Louvre jewels, which French authorities have valued at $157 million.

title.children: INTERPOL issues worldwide alert for 'priceless' stolen Louvre jewels
